Hummm... OK. Given that this can be locked down using ACLs, I guess there is no harm in leaving this in. Let's close this then. Thanks all.
LGTM
I am just running locally to test a potential fix. If if does not fail within 100 runs it seems to be stable. Usually it fails about 1 out of 30 runs. Should take about 1h to verify.
@mjsax Thanks. I'll hold off merging for now.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/5056/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).
DO NOT MERGE YET -- still verifying if this is the correct fix to stabilize the test. Want to trigger some Jenkins build for it.

This is not ready for review or merge. The problem is that the verifiable consumer expects and asserts that it receives continuous offsets. For topics containing transactions, the abort / commit markers occupy one offset, but the message themselves are not returned. THis causes assertion failures in the VerifiableConsumer.

That was my bad overlooking this when merging it. Thanks for the catch @hachikuji . cc @huxihx 

As a hindsight, I'm wondering how the current behavior would not affect the system test usage, as it may auto commit to an offset whose messages have not been printed out on the console (this was what the PR is trying to fix)?
As for the correct fix of KAFKA-5327, maybe we should manually call `commit` inside the console consumer periodically while turning off the auto-commit config.

Also found another issue with the integration test as it is depending on the processed message count to indicate when to commit, but with the multiple-rebalance case some messages may have already been processed before the second rebalance to assign one partition to one thread. Changed to use the value itself to indicate commit, as values are guaranteed to be ordered.

The local runs pass for more than 30+ now.
